```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(readr)
library(dplyr)


#Primero voy a poner el codigo para leer el código binario de las carpetas en cada caso:
# Create a connection object to read the file in binary mode using "rb".
cabecera_FicheroAnalogico <- file("/data/data/519xxxiii14/06_02_2023/14.20.34/cabecera_FicheroAnalogico.dat", "rb")

# First read the column names. n = 3 as we have 3 columns.
column.names <- readBin(cabecera_FicheroAnalogico, character(),  n = 3)

# Next read the column values. n = 18 as we have 3 column names and 15 values.
read.filename <- file("\data\data\0519xxxiii14\06_02_2023\14.20.34\cabecera_FicheroAnalógico.dat", "wb")
bindata <- readBin(read.filename, integer(),  n = 18)

# Print the data.
print(bindata)

# Read the values from 4th byte to 8th byte which represents "cyl".
cyldata = bindata[4:8]
print(cyldata)

# Read the values form 9th byte to 13th byte which represents "am".
amdata = bindata[9:13]
print(amdata)

# Read the values form 9th byte to 13th byte which represents "gear".
geardata = bindata[14:18]
print(geardata)

# Combine all the read values to a dat frame.
finaldata = cbind(cyldata, amdata, geardata)
colnames(finaldata) = column.names
print(finaldata)
```
